xxl.collections
Class DynamicHeap

java.lang.Object
  |
  +--xxl.collections.AbstractQueue
        |
        +--xxl.collections.Heap
              |
              +--xxl.collections.DynamicHeap
public class DynamicHeap
extends Heap

This class provides a dynamical resizable-array implementation of the heap datastructure. In addition to the advantages of a heap this class uses an ArrayResizer to adjust the size of the internally used array automatically to the size of the heap. This means that it is not necessary to specify the maximum capacity of this heap in advance.

Usage example (1). 

     // create an array of objects to store in the heap

     Object[] array = new Object[] {
         new Object[] {
             new Integer(1),
             new String("first")
         },
         new Object[] {
             new Integer(2),
             new String("first")
         },
         new Object[] {
             new Integer(1),
             new String("second")
         },
         new Object[] {
             new Integer(3),
             new String("first")
         },
         new Object[] {
             new Integer(1),
             new String("third")
         }
     };

     // create a comparator that compares the objects by comparing their Integers

     Comparator comparator = new Comparator() {
         public int compare(Object o1, Object o2) {
             return ((Integer)((Object[])o1)[0]).intValue()
                    -((Integer)((Object[])o2)[0]).intValue();
         }
     };

     // create a heap that is initialized with the array and that uses the given comparator

     DynamicHeap heap = new DynamicHeap(array, comparator);

     // insert two elements

     heap.insert(new Object[] {
         new Integer(4),
         new String("first")
     });
     heap.insert(new Object[] {
         new Integer(1),
         new String("fourth")
     });

     // print the elements of the heap

     while (heap.hasNext()) {
         Object[] o = (Object[])heap.next();
         System.out.println("Integer = "+o[0]+" & String = "+o[1]);
     }

     // close the open heap after use

     heap.close();
Usage eyample (2). 
     // refresh the array (it was internally used into the heap and has changed

     array = new Object[] {
         new Object[] {
             new Integer(1),
             new String("first")
         },
         new Object[] {
             new Integer(2),
             new String("first")
         },
         new Object[] {
             new Integer(1),
             new String("second")
         },
         new Object[] {
             new Integer(3),
             new String("first")
         },
         new Object[] {
             new Integer(1),
             new String("third")
         }
     };

     // create an empty heap that uses the given comparator

     heap = new DynamicHeap(comparator);

     // generate an iteration over the elements of the given array

     Iterator iterator = new ArrayCursor(array);

     // insert all elements of the given iterator

     heap.insertAll(iterator);

     // print the elements of the heap

     while (heap.hasNext()) {
         Object[] o = (Object[])heap.next();
         System.out.println("Integer = "+o[0]+" & String = "+o[1]);
     }

     // close the open heap after use

     heap.close();

See Also:
ArrayResizer, ComparableComparator, Comparator, Cursors, Function, Iterator, NoSuchElementException

Field Detail

FACTORY_METHOD

public static final Function FACTORY_METHOD
A factory method to create a new DynamicHeap (see contract for FACTORY_METHOD in interface Queue). It may be invoked with an array (parameter list) (for further details see Function) of object arrays, an iterator or without any parameters. An array (parameter list) of object arrays will be used to initialize the internally used array with the object array at index 0 and an iterator will be used to insert the contained elements into the new DynamicHeap.
See Also:
Function

resizer

protected ArrayResizer resizer
An ArrayResizer managing the growth policy for internally used array. The ArrayResizer decides before an insertion or after an removal of an element whether the array is to be resized or not.
See Also:
ArrayResizer
Constructor Detail

DynamicHeap

public DynamicHeap(Object[] array,
                   int size,
                   Comparator comparator,
                   ArrayResizer resizer)
Constructs a dynamic heap containing the elements of the specified array that returns them according to the order induced by the specified comparator. The heap is initialized by the call of new Heap(array, size, comparator) and the growth policy is managed by the specified ArrayResizer.
Parameters:
array - the object array that is used to store the heap and initialize the internally used array.
size - the number of elements of the specified array which should be used to initialize the heap.
comparator - the comparator to determine the order of the heap.
resizer - an ArrayResizer managing the growth policy for the internally used array.

DynamicHeap

public DynamicHeap(Object[] array,
                   Comparator comparator,
                   ArrayResizer resizer)
Constructs a dynamic heap containing the elements of the specified array that returns them according to the order induced by the specified comparator. This constructor is equivalent to the call of new DynamicHeap(array, array.length, comparator, resizer).
Parameters:
array - the object array that is used to store the heap and initialize the internally used array.
comparator - the comparator to determine the order of the heap.
resizer - an ArrayResizer managing the growth policy for the internally used array.

DynamicHeap

public DynamicHeap(Comparator comparator,
                   ArrayResizer resizer)
Constructs an empty dynamic heap and uses the specified comparator to order elements when inserted. This constructor is equivalent to the call of new DynamicHeap(new Object[0], 0, comparator, resizer).
Parameters:
comparator - the comparator to determine the order of the heap.
resizer - an ArrayResizer managing the growth policy for the internally used array.

DynamicHeap

public DynamicHeap(Object[] array,
                   int size,
                   ArrayResizer resizer)
Constructs a dynamic heap containing the elements of the specified array that returns them according to their natural ordering. This constructor is equivalent to the call of new DynamicHeap(array, size, ComparableComparator.DEFAULT_INSTANCE, resizer).
Parameters:
array - the object array that is used to store the heap and initialize the internally used array.
size - the number of elements of the specified array which should be used to initialize the heap.
resizer - an ArrayResizer managing the growth policy for the internally used array.

DynamicHeap

public DynamicHeap(Object[] array,
                   int size,
                   Comparator comparator)
Constructs a dynamic heap containing the elements of the specified array that returns them according to the order induced by the specified comparator. The growth policy is managed by ArrayResizer.DEFAULT_INSTANCE. This constructor is equivalent to the call of new DynamicHeap(array, size, comparator, ArrayResizer.DEFAULT_INSTANCE).
Parameters:
array - the object array that is used to store the heap and initialize the internally used array.
size - the number of elements of the specified array which should be used to initialize the heap.
comparator - the comparator to determine the order of the heap.

DynamicHeap

public DynamicHeap()
Constructs an empty dynamic heap and uses the natural ordering of the elements to order them when they are inserted. The growth policy is managed by ArrayResizer.DEFAULT_INSTANCE. This constructor is equivalent to the call of new DynamicHeap(new Object[0], 0, ComparableComparator.DEFAULT_INSTANCE, ArrayResizer.DEFAULT_INSTANCE).
See Also:
ArrayResizer.DEFAULT_INSTANCE, ComparableComparator.DEFAULT_INSTANCE

DynamicHeap

public DynamicHeap(Iterator iterator,
                   Comparator comparator)
Constructs a heap containing the elements of the specified iterator that returns them according to the order induced by the specified comparator. This constructor calls the constructor DynamicHeap(comparator) and uses the insertAll method to insert the elements of the specified iterator.
Parameters:
iterator - the iterator whose elements are to be placed into this heap.

DynamicHeap

public DynamicHeap(Iterator iterator)
Constructs a heap containing the elements of the specified iterator that returns them according to their natural ordering. This constructor calls the void constructor and uses the insertAll method to insert the elements of the specified iterator.
Parameters:
iterator - the iterator whose elements are to be placed into this heap.
Method Detail

clear

public void clear()
Removes all of the elements from this heap. The heap will be empty after this call returns so that size() == 0.
Overrides:
clear in class Heap

insert

public void insert(Object object)
Inserts the specified element into this heap and restores the structure of the heap if necessary.
Overrides:
insert in class Heap
Parameters:
object - element to be inserted into this heap.

insertAll

public void insertAll(Iterator objects)
Inserts all of the elements in the specified iterator into this heap and restores the structure of the heap if necessary. The behavior of this operation is unspecified if the specified iterator is modified while the operation is in progress.
Overrides:
insertAll in class Heap
Parameters:
objects - iterator whose elements are to be inserted into this heap.

next

public Object next()
            throws NoSuchElementException
Returns the next element in the heap. The next element of the heap is determined by the comparator.
Overrides:
next in class Heap
Returns:
the next element in the heap.
Throws:
NoSuchElementException - heap has no more elements.

main

public static void main(String[] args)
The main method contains some examples how to use a DynamicHeap. It can also be used to test the functionality of a DynamicHeap.
Parameters:
args - array of String arguments. It can be used to submit parameters when the main method is called.
